Column Comment.0: PHYSICAL ITEM ID: The unique identifier for the physical item.
Column Comment.1: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y or N flag indicating whether this row of data is currentlyeither active/valid (Y) or inactive/invalid (N).
Column Comment.2: BAR CODE: In the event that a bar code is assigned to this item, you may store thebar code here.
Column Comment.3: CATALOGUED USER: The person (name or userID) who catalogued or indexed dthe physical item.
Column Comment.4: CATALOGUE DATE: Date when the physical item was catalogued or indexed
Column Comment.5: CERTIFIED TRUE COPY INDICATOR: a Y / N flag indicating whether this copy ofthe object has been certified as a true copy of the original (or could be the original).This flag is set to Y if the copy has been certified to the level that allows it to beentered in as evidence in court.
Column Comment.6: CIRCULATION ALLOWED INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this physicalitem is allowed to be circulated. In some cases, original files may not be circulated,but copies (as microfilm or scanned documents) may be circulated.
Column Comment.7: CIRCULATION INDICATOR: added for performance. Indicates whether the item isavailable or checked out already.
Column Comment.8: COLOR FORMAT: For digital files, the type of color format that has been used. Maybe expressed as a name (monochrome, greyscale, color) or as a bit value (thenumber of bits used to represent a single pixel of the image. Bitonal images have onebit per pixel, 1 BPP. Often RGB images uses 24 BPP)
Column Comment.9: CREATE DATE: the date on which the physical rendering of the item was created.
Column Comment.10: DIGITAL FORMAT: The digital format, or predefined order or arrangement of digits.For trace data, may be SEG Y or SEG B, for survey data may be UKOOA or SEG P1etc.
Column Comment.11: DIGITAL FILE SIZE: the size of a digital file, in kb or Mb
Column Comment.12: DIGITAL SIZE UNITS OF MEASURE: whether the file size is expressed as kb or Mb.
Column Comment.13: HEIGHT: The physical height of the physical item.
Column Comment.15: LENGTH: The physical length of the physical item.
Column Comment.17: DIMENSION WEIGHT: the actual weight of the physical item.
Column Comment.19: WIDTH: the width of the physical item.
Column Comment.21: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.22: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.23: FILE COUNT: the number of files (or End of Records) that are contained in thisphysical item.
Column Comment.24: GROUP INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating that this physical item is a part of at leastone group. Set this flag when you create groups so that you do not have to blind testthe group table for data.
Column Comment.26: IMAGE X RESOLUTION: the resolution along the X axis of an image stored orreferenced in the RM module. Usually indicated as DPI.
Column Comment.27: IMAGE Y RESOLUTION: The resolution of an image in the Y axis.
Column Comment.28: INFORMATION ITEM CATEGORY: the category of information item, such as May beAcquisition support products, trace products etc.
Column Comment.29: ITEM SUB CATEGORY: THE SUB CATEGORY OF INFORMATION OR PHYSICALITEM. MAY BE ACQUISITION SUPPORT DATA ETC.
Column Comment.30: LABEL: Label or title which has been appended to the physical item which has beencatalogued.
Column Comment.31: LANGUAGE: The form of a means of communicating ideas or feelings by the use ofconventionalized signs, sounds, gestures, or marks having understood meanings.Usually the language used in a document, proceeding, process or application.
Column Comment.32: LAST CONDITION: The condition of the physical item. Allowable entries includepoor, good, unknown. Derived from last circulation.
Column Comment.33: LOCATION REFERENCE: A location reference number, such as a bar code or alegacy system location code, added to enable uninterrupted business processes.
Column Comment.34: MEDIA TYPE ID: unique identifier for the type of media
Column Comment.35: ORIGINAL FILE NAME: the name of the file that was received to be catalogued, suchas abcd.xls.
Column Comment.36: ORIGINAL INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this physical item is theoriginal copy of the information item, as opposed to a duplicate or backup copy.
Column Comment.37: OUTPUT FILE NAME: The name of the file that will be created when the file is outputto a client for use.
Column Comment.38: PAGE COUNT: the total number of pages in the physical item.
Column Comment.39: PHYSICAL ITEM STATUS: The physical status of the item, may be available, lost,destroyed, unknown, etc.
Column Comment.40: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.41: PREFERRED INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this physical item is thecopy of the information item that is preferred for circulation purposes.
Column Comment.42: QUALITY CONTROL USER: The name or userID of the person who did qualitycontrol on the data. Unvalidated so that you can capture name information asreported. If you are able to reference to BUSINESS_ASSOCIATE, use theRM_INFO_DATA_QUALITY or RM_INFO_COORD_QUALITY.
Column Comment.43: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.44: RETENTION PERIOD: The length of time records or materials should be kept in acertain location or form for administrative, legal, fiscal, historical, or other purposes.Retention periods are determined by balancing the potential value of the informationto the agency against the costs of storing the records containing that information.Retention periods are often set for record series, but specific records within thatseries may need to be retained longer because they are required for litigation orbecause circumstances give those records unexpected archival value.
Column Comment.45: SALE ALLOWED INDICATOR: a Y/N flag indicating whether this product isauthorized for transmission to a client (as original or as a copy) in the event of atransaction, sale, data trade etc.
Column Comment.46: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.47: STORE ID: Unique identifier for the data store location. Note that this column isdenormalized from RM PHYS ITEM STORE for query convenience only. If used,should be populated procedurally.
Column Comment.48: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.49: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.50: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.51: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.52: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.53: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.54: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
